title: Erdos Problem #379
statement_text: Let $S(n)$ denote the largest integer such that, for all $1\leq k<n$, the binomial coefficient $\binom{n}{k}$ is divisible by $p^{S(n)}$ for some prime $p$ (depending on $k$). Is it true that\[\limsup S(n)=\infty?\]
notes: Do not treat candidates as verified.
